title: Rivian Update 2026.03 Brings Apple Watch App
text:
Skip to content
Rivian is officially bringing an Apple Watch app to both Gen 1 and Gen 2 R1 vehicles with software version 2026.03, and honestly, this is just cool. We have had phone as key for a while, but now you can control your Rivian straight from your wrist. That feels very on brand.
With the upcoming Rivian mobile app update 3.9, the Apple Watch companion app lets you lock or unlock your doors, vent the windows, sound the alarm, tweak the cabin temperature, and even set your target state of charge using the digital crown. You can also customize it with up to four quick controls, so the stuff you actually use is right there, one tap away.
Gen 2 R1 owners get an extra flex. If digital key is set up, passive entry works with the watch, meaning you can literally walk up to your Rivian and it unlocks as you approach. No digging for your phone. Just walk up, hop in, and go. On Gen 1 R1, you can still lock and unlock with a tap, just make sure the app is foregrounded (actively open) if you want to use it as a key.
Is this life changing? Maybe not. But running out for a quick drive without your phone, preconditioning the cabin while walking across a parking lot, or adjusting your charge limit while standing next to a charger feels way more seamless when it is all on your wrist. It is a small feature that makes the whole experience feel more polished.
Rivian keeps leaning into the software side of things, and this is another reminder that your truck or SUV is part of a bigger ecosystem. And now that ecosystem fits on your watch.
